author: Redazione Web
title: I metalmeccanici manifestano per il rinnovo del contratto: traffico in tilt alla Baraccola
text: ANCONA - Traffico in tilt alla Baraccola per il corteo di protesta dei metalmeccanici. È infatti in corso una manifestazione per chiedere il rinnovo del contratto di lavoro indetta a livello nazionale, che, unita alle condizioni meteo e alla pioggia battente, sta mettendo in difficoltà la circolazione nella zona.

author: 小浪财讯
title: 云计算ETF（516510）跌0.71%，半日成交额7647.67万元|云计算_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
6月19日，截止午间收盘，云计算ETF（516510）跌0.71%，报1.122元，成交额7647.67万元。云计算ETF（516510）重仓股方面， 科大讯飞 截止午盘跌0.55%， 金山办公 跌0.69%， 紫光股份 跌0.91%， 浪潮信息 跌0.78%， 中科曙光 涨0.00%， 新易盛 涨0.13%， 中际旭创 涨3.03%， 恒生电子 跌3.21%， 润和软件 跌1.81%， 润泽科技 跌1.27%。
云计算ETF（516510）业绩比较基准为中证云计算与大数据主题指数收益率，管理人为易方达基金管理有限公司，基金经理为张湛，成立（2021-03-29）以来回报为13.08%，近一个月回报为0.60%。
风险提示：市场有风险，投资需谨慎。本文为AI大模型自动发布，任何在本文出现的信息（包括但不限于个股、评论、预测、图表、指标、理论、任何形式的表述等）均只作为参考，不构成个人投资建议。

author: TNN
title: Delhi-Bound Flights Diverted: Delhi Flights Diverted and Delayed Due to Rain and Wind | Delhi News - Times of India
text: New Delhi: Around 30 Delhi-bound flights were diverted and over 100 flights delayed at IGI Airport because of incessant rain, gusty winds of up to 45kmph and lightning on Wednesday night.Of the 30 flights diverted to other cities, 16 were of IndiGo, six of Air India, and one each of Vistara, Alliance Air, Air India Express, American Airlines, Emirates, Akasa Air, Cathay Pacific. A chartered flight too had to be diverted. Fifteen flights were diverted to Jaipur, nine to Lucknow, three to Amritsar, two to Ahmedabad, and one to Chandigarh between 7.30pm on Wednesday and 1am on Thursday.Indira Gandhi International Airport saw 68.3mm of rainfall till 8.30am on Thursday. The airport recorded a high wind speed at 27kmph, which rose to 45kmph at 7pm on Wednesday. “A frequent change in wind speed impacts flight take-off,” an official said.Many passengers complained about the delays. Anjali, a passenger, said: “My flight from Delhi to Bangkok was delayed by about five hours on Wednesday night. We had to board the flight in the rain as there was no shade.”Rohit Rathore, another passenger, wrote on X that his flight was delayed by over four-and-a-half hours.Delhi Metro recorded a higher number of passenger journeys on Wednesday at 66.6 lakh as against 65.3 lakh a day earlier.A Delhi Metro Rail Corporation official said the passenger journeys rose on Wednesday as many people preferred the metro when heavy rain lashed the city and caused traffic snarls and waterlogging.On June 28, when the city had seen heavy rain, DMRC had recorded over 69 lakh passenger journeys. We also published the following articles recentlyBiohazard on United Airlines flight: Crew vomiting, passengers ask for masks, flight divertedA United Airlines flight from Houston to Boston was diverted to Washington D.C. after a passenger's illness caused a biohazard situation. Both crew members and passengers started feeling unwell, leading to the emergency landing. The plane underwent a deep clean, with no medical assistance required for the 155 passengers and six crew members.112094025Passengers exact 'revenge' on Delta Airlines following flight delays - Did they go too far?Two passengers protested Delta Airlines by raiding its VIP lounge after their flights were delayed due to a Microsoft outage. They emptied hand sanitizer dispensers, poured out wine, and took magazines, documenting their actions on TikTok. The video has gone viral, capturing support from the online community. Delta has not yet responded.112055015Air Canada flight cancelled due to flight attendant's 'inappropriate behaviour'A Montreal-bound Air Canada flight from Casablanca was canceled after a flight attendant was caught on video yelling at a passenger over a blanket request. The incident occurred on Friday and resulted in passengers being delayed until Sunday. Air Canada confirmed the cancellation, switched crews, and offered compensation, expressing regret over the incident.112115126

author: Glenn Kelly
title: Ronan Hale knocks out Coleraine with extra-time hat-trick – The Irish News
text: Ronan Hale was the hat-trick hero as he grabbed all three of his side’s goals in a flattering 3-0 victory over a dejected Coleraine in the fifth-round of the Clearer Water Irish Cup tie at the Showgrounds. All three goals came in extra-time, after a goal-less 90 minutes, that saw both sides lose a man each to a red card. The defeat heaps more misery on under-pressure manager Oran Kearney whose Coleraine side exited the Irish Cup at this stage for only the third time in 16 years. With new signings Jack Scott and Rory Brown starting for the Bannsiders, hopes were high of a turn of fortune for a side on the back of four straight defeats. However, it was the side from Solitude that had the opening chance of the game after only five minutes. Ben Wilson got the better of Dean Jarvis down Coleraine’s left and whipped an inviting ball across the front of goal, where Sean Stewart raced in from the opposite flank, but he failed to hit the target with the goal at his mercy. The first period was an open affair with both sides showing some attacking intent, however it was the away side that looked the more likely to score; that was until the half-hour mark when the hosts had a glorious opportunity to break the deadlock. A misplaced pass out of defence from Mr.Reliable Johnny Addis arrived at the feet of Jamie Glackin, who picked out Lee Lynch, who in turn tried to pick out the on-rushing Scott. But his pass was a poor one and the debutant couldn’t get on the end of the ball as the score remained goal-less and that’s the way it stayed until the break. Jim Magilton’s visitors started the second period on top but failed to work goalkeeper Brown in the Coleraine goal, as both sides became less prepared to take risks as the half progressed. As the game petered out towards extra-time, it was the production of cards from referee Raymond Crangle, rather than goals that would make headlines. With 10 minutes on the clock, Reds substitute Sam Ashford was shown a straight red card after a high challenge on Dean Jarvis. He was swiftly followed by Coleraine player Lyndon Kane, on his 300th club appearance, for his second-yellow card for a follow-through tackle that seemed harsh, as neither side could find a winner in 90 minutes. After a tetchy start to extra-time, on 95 minutes, Rory Hale thought he had broken the deadlock. Ben Wilson with a smart lay-off to the incoming midfielder, who smashed an effort form 20 yards, but it was expertly saved by Brown in goal at full stretch to his left. However, it was his brother Ronan who did open the scoring nine minutes later. The striker scored his sixth goal in six games with a stunning curling effort into the top right-hand corner of the Coleraine net from just outside the area, giving Brown no chance this time. As Coleraine pushed for an equaliser, Ronan Hale grabbed his second of the night four minutes from time to send the Reds through. A smart turn inside the box and a cool finish broke Coleraine hearts. However, the younger Hale wasn’t done there, and within thirty seconds had his hat-trick. A through ball from midfield beat the Coleraine offside trap, and there was Hale with all the time in the world to beat Brown and slot home for a memorable victory. Coleraine: Brown, Kane (capt), D. Jarvis, A. Jarvis, McDaid, Farren, Lynch, Glackin, J. Scott, O’Mahony, A. Scott. Subs: Gallagher, Lowry, O’Donnell, Cole, McLaughlin, Devine, O’Hara. Cliftonville: Odumosu, Stewart, Addis, Doherty, Rory Hale (capt), Gormley, Casey, Turner, Ronan Hale, Kearney, Wilson. Subs: Gartside, Pepper, Curran, McDonagh, Jordan, Ashford, McGuinness.

author: Inspector Clueso Community
title: Cult of Klan, Christ, Yahweh, and Trump: By God, Let's Stop It
text: To tweak (and perhaps burnish) Lord Acton: Almighty power corrupts absolutely. For several decades and counting, God’s Own Party (GOP) has had its cake and eaten the known universe. If that sounds overblown, let’s look. As the Southern Poverty Law Center’s Morris Dees (Hate on Trial, A Lawyer’s Journey) reveals, the once-proud “Party of Lincoln” now shares common, blood-soaked ground with the longtime Cross-flaunting, pro-GOP Ku Klux Klan- and with the underreported, un-American Aryan Nations. Don’t look now, but the Proudly Boyish Republican clan now openly touts Adolf Hitler. And bust my buttons! As God is my witness, so does Trump chum Nick “I LOVE HITLER!” Fuentes. According to Mother Jones’s Kiera Butler’s firsthand account (“My Deeply Unsettling Return to the Moms for Liberty Conference,” 7/6/23), so has MFL co-founder Tiffany Justice. Not to mention the self-styled “Chosen One” Himself- who echoes, with evident impunity, the Fuhrer’s wails for “vengeance” on “vermin,” while effectively howling for a “bloodbath” that he suggests would culminate in President Biden’s execution. Talk about conflicted. On one hand, rabid tuskers effectively (and often overtly) endorse such fascism-writ-large. On the other hand- never mind the Aryan Nations’, the Klan’s, und der Fuhrer’s animus toward Jews- the GOP styles itself, in effect, as the champion (if not the avatar) of Yahweh. (Go figure.) Be it resolved: history repeats. In 1980, the KKK cheered Ronald ‘The Neshoba Firebrand’ Reagan. In 2016, it feted the parental pelf-made swell who’d been flagged by the DOJ (in 1973) for race-based housing discrimination. As ever, what we don’t know can hurt us. Growing up, I had no clue that, in 1885, within screaming distance of the future site of my home (in Towson, Maryland), some Klannish thugs had imposed (you guessed it) trial by fire-and-rope. (Sweeping such stuff under the rug, while eternally idolizing Reagan- who, in 1971, smeared some African UN delegates as “monkeys”- what could possibly go wrong?) Granted, our domestic terrorists have slain far more African American Christians than they have Jews. Still, last time I checked, neither the American Klan nor the German Reich was well-disposed to the latter. To memory-hole the former’s violent anti-Semitism (as Big News has done) can’t help but tend to normalize-and-enable the creeping, violent, America-scourging tyranny we now see around us. Or to which we turn blind eyes. Better late than never, Dems need to face the fact that, through time, the conventional wisdom has given the Gipper’s and then Big Blonder’s cult carte blanche to wage “holy war” (quoting Jerry Falwell) six ways to Sunday. All while battling, in a sense, from BOTH SIDES: that is, as purportedly pro-Jewry, while still (now far from subtly) pro-Nazi. In other words, (re the latter), pro-snake. (For a motto, the GOP could aptly deploy Lady Macbeth’s advice to her seditious spouse: “Look like the innocent flower/ But be the serpent under it.”) At bottom, for roughly 45 years, the so-called “liberal media” have fundamentally equated “the religious right” with religion, period. Predictably enough, not unlike the titular horror in the late Baltimorean Billie Holiday’s “Strange Fruit,” our body politic now hangs in the balance. To stress what should be obvious: let NO person or party get off scot free while spouting pro-Nazi screed. Let those who foist such flagrant evil on our great country be smitten harshly at the polls- and, to the fullest extent of the law, face punishment (for God’s sake, amen).
